U6sNanrgEOmCQF_no_1nZA.text: Super simple and super yummy. This place totally hit the spot. I got the spicy ramen noodle combo with gyoza. That was more than enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Sanji Kagoshima Ramen - Singapore, Singapore. Spicy Ramen with gyoza

h6180JXGnlN4NVec_73_PQ.text: I've had better in Japan of course but so far in Singapore this may be my favorite ramen. It's a cool vibe with indoor and outdoor seating. Reasonable prices. Good lunch and early evening specials. Definitely worth a visit if staying close by.

Sjl0IpDH_hbE2QQOyUrxjQ.text: Decent ramen with good broth in the Tanjong Pagar area. The chasu wasn't super impressive but the broth was. I tried the black sesame ramen which I found to be unique.

photos.caption: Photo of Sanji Kagoshima Ramen - Singapore, Singapore. Black sesame ramen

2VVc8tldI_hOGynREWqn2g.text: Ramen was great! I had the Extremely Hot Ramen for $14.90++ and it was shiok! Beware! It's really quite spicy. There are 3 levels of additional spiciness and I selected the first additional level - Medium Hot. The ramen came with a large dollop of chili powder on the side and the soup broth was crimson. Whew! It was delicious but I think I wouldn't advance beyond the Medium Hot level. This was plenty hot for me!My wife and daughter had the house signature ramen ($11.50++) and it was pretty good too. The broth was thick and milky. May be a tad salty for some.The restaurant is small, with space for 12 diners in the area at the back. The bar counter sits another 6. There is an alfresco option as well, but with not very many seats. Credit cards accepted and you pay at the front cashier after your meal.Overall a nice dining experience and I'll be back for more whenever I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sanji Kagoshima Ramen - Singapore, Singapore. Close up of my noodles before I devour them!
Photo of Sanji Kagoshima Ramen - Singapore, Singapore. Extremely Hot Ramen! Medium Hot level with a dollop of chili powder on the side.

HadGG-BulYF1zct5UfT8RA.text: I'm traveling a lot around the globe, each city I visit I try a Ramen, eating a Ramen at Sanji Kagoshima was something exceptional. I can definitely say, the best Ramen I ever had. extremely well balanced between sweetness, sourness, and smoothly hot. Your hand sending your spoon again and again, praying this moment will never stop, generously added soup for only 2$ more - guys, it is heaven! I can definitely understand why they got 5 stars.

9w0uo6ljtQaITxaqgH62Jw.text: Ok so Tonkotsu King has silly long queues so we gave this a shot and was pleasantly surprised. Friendly attentive service, high quality pork broth which has character. The pickles were excellent.The large portion with eveything in (pork, egg, nori) was particularly satisfying.

JObJ5iO2rS3w4b_vJpzfug.text: I think the waiter and the cook are from Japan (at least the water is), so the ramen is surprisingly decent. The restaurant is cozy and small. Very nice dining experience here.
